greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: In decimal representation of n: replace all even digits with 0 and all odd digits with 1.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..9999
program: a103181 n = foldl f 0 $ reverse $ unfoldr g n where
f v d = 10 * v + mod d 2
g x = if x == 0 then Nothing else Just $ swap $ divMod x 10
(PARI) a(n)=subst(Pol(apply(k->k%2, digits(n))),'x,10) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 16 2013
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 18 2005
